title: Family Journal 559AZ: Happy Holidays
excerpt: Happy CV-19 holidays! This year everyone is virtual (not just the holidays, but literally all year), which is great as our family is naturally virtual first, and having everyone be really good at video calls, and video calling software getting better and better is a boon for us! We actually used the software I built to make some "virtual selfies". Here's our christmas call:

title: Family Journal 556AZ: Hot tub xmas tree
excerpt: I couldn't decide if this was a bucket list or not, but I've always wanted a hot tub, and now I have one! I didn't love Corona Virus, but I am glad it helped me flesh out my backyard with fire pit, canopy and inflatable hot tub. I wish I figured that out back in my 20s!!

title: Family Journal 553AZ: Happy Corona Virus Thanksgiving
excerpt: It’s thanksgiving, it’s corona virus, it’s a week I got off work, and the kids got off school. Due to corona virus, (and my lack of self discipline) we mostly stayed at home, relaxed and knocked some easy stuff off our collective todo list. I did get one walk in with both kids in Interlaken which was really nice.

title: Family Journal 550.1AZ:  Amelia, reading, writing and motivating!
excerpt:
**You can do it meow, meow**

Several days a week, I bike Amelia to school in her pod. The pod is up a steep hill so I have bike 4mph up while huffing and puffing. Every time as I go up the hill Amelia is behind me singing "You can do it, meow, meow, you can do it meow, meow". Which is very motivating.

title: Family Journal 550AZ:Halloween 2020, Tori Super party!!!
excerpt:
This year, thanks to the Corona there's no trick or treating, **but Tori made up for it by making the worlds greatest halloween party,** You can see it if you have permissions here. A few highlights:

* Amazing Food

title: Family Journal 549AZ: Good Habits and a sliver of the good life
excerpt:
Saturday we donned our masks and went to a corn maze for Zach's friend's birthday. It was a crisp day, and we had a nice time. Getting out is a good habit to get into!

Zach has been joining me for nightly walks, he's gotten lucky that my leg is a injured so I can't go far, it's very enjoyable for me to get some quality talking time. Amelia likes it too. Zach doesn't love getting his picture taken, but when he's in VR, he doesn't really know what to be objecting to:

title: Family Journal 545AZ: Morning Snuggles
excerpt: This weekend I've been feeling lazy, and just sitting in the easy chair in the living room the morning. If Amelia sees me in the living room chair, she'll curl up in my lap and snuggle with me. Today I decided to read some poems with her (I love Shel Silverstein), and to my amazement, she read a few words. After reading poems for a while, she brought out her reading homework, and we did a bit of it. She's gotten much better at reading - the pod is really helping. What a great thing to savor.

title: Family Journal 544AZ: Happy Yom Kippur AC
excerpt:
After not seeing our good friends Miga, Brian, Kai and Ceil and they came by and brought us a great joke - we haven't done that since BC. Before Corona - BC - Get it?

Anywhoo, we haven't seen them since BC, and it was great to catch up. We enjoyed some wonderful sliders that Tori made while roasting marshmallows on the back yard fire pit.

title: Family Journal 543AZ: The Rabbi and the really small apartment
excerpt:
**Before we begin**

Long ago there lived a woman in a very small house. At her wits end she went to her Rabbi and said “Rabbi, my house is so small, there’s not enough room for my family”. The Rabbi looked at her thoughtfully and said, “Not a problem, I know exactly what to do - bring a chicken in your house”.

title: Family Journal 541 AZ: Back to school - Virtual and Physical
excerpt:
This summer had glorious weather (over shadowed by Pandemic-I), but all things come to an end and now it’s fall, and the kids are back to school.

Zach with his strong academics, and computer skills starts school online. He’s excited to see his friends and start helping out, and to help him along he got a new computer. Of course, he’s much less interested in using the computer for school, and much more interested in having a computer that can play some serious games.

title: Achievement Unlocked: Zach the Programmer and Chef
excerpt:
I don't think I've ever felt the over powering pride I imagine grand parents feel when they hold their grand child. Until today.

If you're not me, this post sucks for you to read, but I want every detail so I can savor it forever. There are several events that happened.

title: Family Journal 537 AZ: Island Hopping
excerpt: Some days you nail it, and yesterday was one of those days. Sick of being cooped up in the house, I decided we'd go biking on an island. Being the planner I am, I stuck Amelia on my bike and headed to the ferry terminal. When the ferry guy asked me where I was going, I asked where's the next ferry that's departing going - and off to Bremerton we went!

title: Family Journal 535AZ: Summer Days
excerpt: Ah the middle of summer. Nothing says summer like some kids playing in a sprinkler on a hot day. Amazingly we were blessed with discovering our neighbor has a kid Amelia's age who's here every other week and loves to play. This lets both of them get a biking buddy, and play buddy. Super nice.

title: Family Journal 531AZ: Houses and Drunken Bike Batteries
excerpt: Tori has been making huge progress on the house. She’s built a trellis, stained the glass, and plannted a Unicorn. Tori and I have many differences, but we certainly share what a cool house looks like:

title: Family Journal 528AZ: Home Improvement
excerpt:
Amelia is eating our first strawberry of the seasons

Tori got tired of the cats knocking out the WiFi so she helped me ceiling mount the electronics. She also helped me jurry rig a window opener, which is feels very much like something I'd come with myself .

title: Family Journal 527AZ: Riding with Influencers
excerpt: Today, was fantastic weather and Amelia and I biked down to the beach (45min away, thank you e-bike!). On the way, Amelia was telling me about being an influencer, and how she had lots of followers on Youtube and on Instragram. I told her I only have 3 or 4 followers, and she said that's OK, she'd ask her followers to follow me instead.

title: Family Journal 526AZ: They Yard
excerpt: Yards are cool things that don't get nearly enough air time. Tori is building a herb octopus cat scratcher darth vader side of the house, and I'm living large on the other side under the purple canopy. Expect more front yard adventures soon.

title: Family Journal 525 AZ: Amelia learned to ride her bike
excerpt: There's something magical about watching a kid learning to bike. First they don't know how, then they do but they're afraid, and then magically, they are riding as if they've been doing it their whole life.

title: Family Journal 514 AZ:  I have arrived
excerpt:
Most weeks are a blur, but some weeks you take some time to breath, and realize just how amazing your life is. This is one of those weeks.

## First some cute things Amelia moments:

**Amelia was interested in birth, and she said.**

title: Achievement Unlocked: Resilient and Persevering children.
excerpt:
Amelia, Zach I am so proud of you. There is nothing in life that is more importance then resilience and perseverance (maybe discipline) and you two have it in spades.

Zach - You’re a pleasure. You are an entrepreneur and hacker. You will grind through. You have a web site, a discord server, you are streaming, you have a Patreon account, and are making more money from then from your allowance (technically from your allowance, if you did your chores, which you don’t  ). Through all of this you had to learn, and try, and try again when you failed. When your Dad put off doing things you pushed and pushed (like the domain name, like the certificates, like the patreon account) till you got it done. This resilience and preservance is what makes you great!

title: Family Journal 513: Wheels
excerpt:
Turns out I have a thing for wheels! But I guess you know that if you know me, or have read my eulogy This week I got a cargo bike to carry around my most prized possessions - my roller skates.

Kidding! I got the cargo bike to carry my most prized possession - Amelia and Zach. Pictures of the kids on it pending (it's currently really cold).

title: Family Journal 512AZ: Progress
excerpt: Zach presented McBeth this week. Very impressive. It reminds me why being a dad is awesome. First I couldn't really see anything, I couldn't really hear anything, and I'm pretty sure I don't understand McBeth, however, when Zach got up there and did his bit, I was filled with pride and joy - wow!!! Zach's role included killing another character called "Young Siward". Zach enjoyed that.

title: Family Journal 511AZ: Always follow your dreams
excerpt:
January was busy and energy draining, and it's finally over! I now have time to focus on things that nourish my soul. For example - check out my hard hat liner super warm hat:

And, I do love magic tricks that end with cards on ceilings:

title: Family Journal 510AZ: Roller Afternoon
excerpt: This afternoon was very fun, and I really tried to enjoy it. We went roller skating (which Amelia and I love), and then we had ice cream (which everyone loves), and in the middle we had BBQ (which had a photo of Jesus and Elvis):

title: Family Journal 507: Clowning Around
excerpt:
I'm not sure how it took me 41 years, but I now have my own clown wig! Very busy week, very busy month.

**From Amelia:**

Matin Luther Kind Jr wanted people not to fight, so make his dream come true, and treat others like you want them to try you, and that is the golden rule.

title: Family Journal 506: Unicorns are the best and they care a lot
excerpt: _Tomorrow I head back to work, the kids head back to school, and Tori gets to regain her sanity. I'm going to have a very busy month, so remind me to take lots of photos, do my good habits, and enjoy the ride!

title: Happy Jump in the lake day 2020
excerpt: Welcome to 2020! As usual, it’s jump in the lake day!! This is the day we celebrate saying F#\$ You to the resistance. The resistance lies, telling us things are hard, when they are not. The resistance adds suffering, when there is minimal pain - and that confuses us into not doing the things which give us the most value, joy, and positive identity.

title: Family Journal 505:  Merry XMas VR Edition
excerpt:
Lots of sick grown ups and sick little people this holidays so a bit of a low energy xmas. Also, way behind on my blog posts so it'll be a clearinghouse of post-porrui.

Dave went on vacation and loaned us his VR headset. I can say 1) super fun 2) do not do VR boxing near your TV.

title: Family Journal 503: Great Wolf Lodge
excerpt: Great wolf lodge is this really cool water park resort an hour and a half south of us. We went for a day and spent a bunch of time in the pool! Zach kept doing the big water slide and wanted me to go, but I was a bit afraid. I really enjoyed the wave pool, I've never been in one before. Trust be told, this was the first time I'd even done a small water slide ant it was kind of scary. Kai, Ciel and Brian joined us. Sadly, they didn't Miga was sick, so she couldn't come. It was super fun.

title: Week 499AZ: Fanny Pack Perfection
excerpt: Usually I give the microphone to the family, but today lets talk about me. I've been on the hunt for the perfect fanny pack. Tori is going insane as I've purchased over 10 (maybe even 15) fanny packs. It's been a tough journey, I've often thought I had the perfect fanny pack, but then the quality would be bad, or the material would rip, or the pockets would be wrong. But, now I think I have a great fanny pack, except for the color. Tori tells me if I don't buy another fanny pack for 3 weeks, she'll help me decorate this one! Fingers crossed.

title: Week 497 AZ: Happy Halloween
excerpt:
We were Lamas for Halloween this year, which is always fun. Zach would not be a lama, but he looked great in his costume too.

Amelia wanted to go to "Treat Street" a neighborhood that looks cool and is jam packed. Zach realized it was a bad deal. Better to hang out where there are less people and more candy was Zach's optimization point. This was the year Zach and Amelia went to the door by themselves, and I just stood at the side walk waving politely to the parents. Kids grow up, parents grow up. Check.

title: Week 496AZ: Busy
excerpt: This week has been busy at work. Really busy, but you know the good thing about being busy? Busy people get stuff done. For example, I dressed up in a lama suit and took Amelia to sushi. At sushi she used chop sticks (super cool). I also rode her on an electric bike while wearing a lama suit which got many smiles and waves of appreciation. I think screaming like we were on a roller coaster helped too. Did I mention I got a super cool jacket, and the neighbor kittens come into our home and lick our plates? Yeah, they do.

title: Week 495AZ: Collected Wisdom
excerpt:
Life gets busy, and it's so easy to forget to smell (and record) the roses. First some pictures, then some very adorable conversations:

With Amelia:

I've had to leave early of late and haven't been able to walk Amelia to school in the morning so I left here a letter explaining that with a picture of us. I told her about the piece of paper and she said

title: Achievement Unlocked: Lemonade Stand
excerpt:
The lemonade stand - the first right of passage for the young entrepreneur.

After weeks of nagging Tori and I to run a lemonade stand, Baba came to the rescue and helped Zach run his first lemonade stand. It turned into a family affair with Baba conscripted as chef, Amelia as salesperson and Dad as driver.

title: Week 490AZ: Shotguns and school starting
excerpt: Ten minutes after Amelia was born I took her onto the balcony and rocked her. In a flash of insight, my mind was flooded with her future. First Boyfriend, Graduation, Marriage, Kids . I vividly remember thinking I'd need to buy a shot gun to shoot the boys that would inevitably come into her future.

title: Achievement Unlocked: First Concert - Weird Al
excerpt:
Zach and I saw Weird Al at the Paramount!

There comes a point when you **stop doing things with your kids because they want to do it,** and **start doing it because you want to do it.** This weekend, it was the latter! Zach and I saw Weird Al which was super fun. Kudos to Tori for finding out the show was in town and suggesting we go for it!

title: Week 485AZ: Week of wonders and lighting stuff on fire
excerpt:
It's been a busy week. I have not been lighting stuff on fire, except my free time. My free time has spend on my intern talk -what I wish I knew when I was 22, and I really enjoyed presenting it.

I also got into fanny packs, and after a few weeks have a giant one. As part of preparing my talk, I realized how important it is to have fun, so I started taking selfies. It's a fun habit and I'm working on it.

title: Week 479AZ: Zach to Work (and Amelia)
excerpt:
This week was bring your kids to work week. Zach came, and looked all grown up:

There was a Microsoft reunion on Friday, and it was awesome to see everyone that I started my career with. Foolishly, I brought no pictures. Thank fully, I've been taking lots of family pictures, and that's great cuz I don't have much else to say:

title: Week 478AZ: Biking in Bandon with the Stephens
excerpt:
This week was a Stephen's family reunion, and we joined them in Bandon Oregon. Bandon is on the pacific ocean, has fantastic views, and very friendly people.

I brought the "bikes" with us, and now bikes is my bike, Zach's bike **and** Amelia's bike.

title: Week 474AZ:  Lunch on Zach at Folk Life
excerpt: This weekend is memorial day, and in Seattle that means a huge free festival at the space needle called Folk Life. The third graders at Zach's school went to the first day of Folk Life on Friday and put on a concert. I got to come with them (but did have to leave early). There was a bit of drama because the class was going to sing "This land is my land" and "roll on Columbia", but at the 11th hour they discovered it wasn't nice to the Indians, so they had to cut out those songs.

title: Week 470AZ:  I'm one hand big
excerpt: Another year - Amelia's turned 5 and Zach 9. It happens to everyone (with kids) your kids grow up. One day you look at them and you're like Wow - Zach's almost as tall as Tori, Amelia's doing the monkey bars, I've got streaks of grey in my beard (and my hair, that disappeared long ago).

title: Week 469AZ: Special Zach Edition
excerpt:
Amelia and Zach are both awesome kids. This week Zach's done some extra fun stuff some I'm gonna do a special edition.

Saturday, I went upstairs for an hour, came downstairs, and was blown away, Zach had done a full page expose. I asked him on what and he said it's on his video game, and he was doing a walk through. AMAZING! I ran to tell Tori how incredible it was that Zach had done that, and Tori was like "Oh -- he's procrastinating, he's supposed to be doing his science fair project"

title: Week 468AZ: Vacation at Legoland!
excerpt: We went to Lego Land! Tori set it up so we'd stay in the Lego Land hotel - which was incredible, we were able to go to the park, take a nap in the middle of our park day, and head back into the park all rested up. The kids loved it. Amelia was so excited she actually woke up early and got me out of bed to tell me how excited she was! Her excitement was contagious and we had a fantastic time.

title: Week 467AZ: Pierced Ears
excerpt: Usually, I'm the first to get up, and Amelia's the last. This Saturday morning, I was reading upstairs and I heard the patter of Amelia feet. She cautiously poked her head upstairs. I said "Amelia, how come you're awake?" and she ran up and answered "I'm so excited I can't sleep - I'm getting my ears pierced".

title: Achievement Unlocked: Busking at pike place
excerpt:
I don't have a bucket list, but if I did, you know what would be on it? Performing magic (busking) at the top tourist attraction in Seattle - Pike Place Market.

As if that's not a big enough accomplishment, that got combined with riding Amelia on my folding bike to the pike place market, and bringing home flowers for Tori.

title: Week 462AZ: Too much Magic
excerpt: Perfect weather this weekend, and we got out to enjoy it. We hit a few parks, and got down to the beach, and even brought out the blow torch to finish off some Souse Vide steak! My highlight for the week was Amelia's stories.

title: Week 461AZ: First bike to work of the year.
excerpt: Technically I biked the Monday after this week, I biked from work (instead of to work), and I decided last year I'm better off taking the time I spend biking to work and going to the gym instead. But in practice, I'd skipped the gym, it was a sunny day, and I felt like a bike ride - and it felt great!

title: Week 460AZ: I'm sad because I won't get to see you
excerpt:
Amelia and Zach are at a sleep over. I got home before Amelia left, and as she was leaving she was all teared up and upset. I went up to her, and held her while she cried:

I: Amelia - what's wrong?

A: I won't get to see you tonight.

title: Week 459AZ: OMG - That's some serious snow
excerpt:
I thought last week was snowy. This week has been so much snow school was cancelled 3 days and late start 2 days. It's snowing again tonight so school's already cancelled Monday.

This weekend I got into the snow with the kids. Which worked out as tweaking my back while making a snowman with Amelia, recovering and then ripping out my back doing some snow fort building with Zach. I'm typing this wearing a back support, here's hoping to a pleasant tomorrow. In good news, one thing that really helps with my back is going to the gym, and I've been slacking so this will be a good reminder.

title: Week 458AZ: Mommy I love you!
excerpt:
Tori's been very very very busy getting her play to open, so I've been trying to get home at a reasonable time for a baby sitter or Miga or Tori kid-handoff. It's also been a busy work week.

The kids (and I) missed Tori so much, they even made an emergency sign:

title: Week 457AZ: Magic Magic
excerpt: Today is Sunday and Igor came home from his magic festival. Igor was in Ohio for MagiFest, a major magician conference from Thursday to Sunday, where he got to see one of the worlds greatest living magicians - Juan Tamariz.

title: Week 456AZ: Sunny in January
excerpt:
This has been a busy week at work, but a few highlights.

Private Magic Lessons - I took my first private lesson, and that was awesome! My coach is really good at coins, so he has me working some coin routines I haven't been doing in years. He's also cleaned up some of my rubber band work, and brought me some great ideas on how to practice.

title: Week 455AZ:  Video Edition
excerpt:
This was the last week of the kids holidays! We had lots of fun. and I'll trying posting some videos for a change:

Amelia loves her "ball pool", and she loves sword fighting (although she's still got some learning to do). Amelia and I went to a pretty sweet disco/country party where we got to dance and listen to live music.

title: Happy Jump in the lake day 2019
excerpt: Another year, another jump. I jump in the lake to remind myself that even though the resistance tells me "something awful will happen" or "you'll hate this" or "oh my god are you crazy" it's all a big fat lie, and I'll be fine. It's the difference between pain and suffering, "Physical pain" which is real, often tiny, and quickly acclimatized to, and "Mental Suffering" which is completely in your head, often huge, and if left untreated expands to ovewhelm you.

title: Week 452AZ: Blogbing for Xbox
excerpt:
Zach wants an XBox and Dad wants to have a weekly family journal. I think we've got a win/win situation coming on. Lots of good pictures to share.

Zach is becoming popular with the ladies (no, I mean technically I am good friends). Zach also discovered the magical wold of modded mine craft. For you technopeasants out there (including Dad), modded minecraft is: Voxeltov.

title: Week 447AZ: Zach's post: Cookies are da best
excerpt:
Zach's contributing to this week's post, and Igor is looking forward to getting the kids more involved:

From Zach:

Happy Thanksgiving everyone (in 2 days). Wreck it Ralph is coming out tomorrow I think and x-mas is sooner then you expect #happy_face. What is your favorite part about x-mas? Leave it below in the comments.

title: Week 443AZ: Busy Magic Chair Parents
excerpt: This week has been B-U-S-Y. Tori's got a play going into tech which means she's pulling 12 hour days, and my work is getting busy as we get close to Turkey 5 (it's fun being in retail as you get to see neat words). To make it more interesting, there is a magic conference this weekend (which is where I'm writing this). It's my first magic conference, and I'm inspired with some new material (3 months from now watch out!).

title: Week 442AZ: Amelia day
excerpt: Sunday Tori ran off with Zach, and Amelia and I got a spend a wonderful fall day together. We started by face painting. Then we enjoyed a walk in the arboretum, where we ran into Ryan walking Kirby (his dog) and Amelia took the leash for a bit.

title: Week 441AZ: Strawberry milk shots
excerpt: In our home the kids have a habit of midnight snack. It's a final snack before going to bed (I know, it need some work to get healthy, but we'll get there). Usually it's Tori or I grabbing something but last night Zach took command.

title: Week 440AZ: Pumpkin Patch
excerpt: Every year we go to a pumpkin patch - and this being a year, off we went. As usual, it's better with the Miga's so we we followed them there. Everyone had a hoot, don't let the boys expression fool you - they enjoyed it too.

title: Week 439AZ: A perfect day in the life
excerpt:
Today I nailed my perfect day. That day when I live my priorities.

Physical Health - I woke up @ 5am, and went to the gym @ 5:30am

Family - I got home @ 7:30am to walk Zach to school, the came back to give Amelia a hug

title: Week 433AZ: Canada Vacation 2018
excerpt:
For this year's vacation we hung out with Yelana, Justin and Sam in Muskoka at a giant house. Then we hang out with Baltasar, Rada and their family.

Yelana and Justin booked a giant house on a resort. It was awesome staying at a resort with a pool, lake, free boat rentals and nightly shows. While we were Amelia lived in the pool, and the whole family got out boating on the lake. I took my first stab at paddle boarding, zach took his first stab swimming in a lake, and Amelia took here first Kayak ride (with Zach and I).

title: Week 432AZ: We're off to see the family
excerpt: Every year we make a pilgrimage to see my sister. Sometimes she comes to our neck of the woods, and every other year we go to hers. This year we're heading to Ontario, where we'll be staying in a family beach resort. In fact I'm there getting sunspots from watching the pretty orange sunrise.

title: Week 431AZ: New Job, New Health Kick
excerpt:
I started my new job this week. It's always fun to get a new set of challenges, but also very energy consuming to learn a whole bunch of new things.

Since I'm starting new things, I'm also starting a new health kick. I'll pause it for my upcoming vacation, but now that I'm almost back to 200lbs, I need to put energy and weight back on the top of my priority list.

title: Week 430AZ: Hanging with the Tori clan
excerpt:
This week was the first Tori clan family re-union it was great!

Amelia had a few awesome conversations this week:

A: I can't wait to see how big I am tomorrow?

I: How do you mean?

A: I get bigger every single day, I wonder how much bigger I'll be this week.

title: Tori and the technicolor patio
excerpt: When you're visiting our backyard, you might wonder about our technicolor patio. You might wonder how one ends up with such a thing. It's a great thing to wonder and I wish I had pictures for the whole journey.

title: Week 429AZ: The perfect is the enemy of the done
excerpt: The Tori clan has begun to descend on Seattle for their first ever family re-union. It's exciting to meet her family! The re-union begins next week, and we're all looking forward to it. They've done cool things like removing the door that was supporting our back porch. I'm a bit worried about the remaining structural integrity of the porch, but I'm usually a bit paranoid about these things and it's nice to unlock a new storage area.

title: Week 428AZ: Swimming in Canadia
excerpt: We did a 2 day trip to Vancouver this weekend and it was an incredible impromptu vacation. We went swimming at Stanley park's second beach (The greatest swimming pool of all time) and also at the North Vancouver motel's parking lot pool (Which to the kids was the second greatest pool of all time).

title: Week 424AZ: Happy 40th Birthday to me
excerpt: I've been skipping birthdays since I've been 14, but this year Tori threw me a birthday party for my 40th birthday. Zach and Amelia running up to my bed wishing me a happy birthday felt great. Because I've never celebrated my birthday, I've never had that experience before. At first it was irritating to get the birthday wishes, and to get them on the wrong day, but as the day went on I started enjoying the wishes, it was really nice.

title: Week 423 AZ: Memorial Day
excerpt:
Happy Memorial day! It's been a fun week. We're dog sitting Kirby, Ryan's dog, which both Amelia and Tori love. I've been cognitively productive, which always make me happy.

The highlight of my week was biking Amelia to preschool (and it has its own blogpost).

title: Achievement Unlocked: Subway biking Amelia to Pre-School
excerpt: One of the biggest quality of life improvements I've made is walking Zach to school. We live 5 minutes from school, so it's pretty easy. I've always wanted to do the same for Amelia but her school is a 30 minute drive away, so it wasn't really practical.

title: Week 421AZ: Camping
excerpt:
_This was a fun week.

I went to my first magic show, and it was an awesome one, David Blaine at the Paramount. First, I'd never been to the paramount, and second I'd never been to a magic show. I'm told David Blaine is as good as it gets, and it was pretty frickin cool. What really amazed me is that what he was doing could easily boring - like watching him hold his breath for 10 minutes, the show was able to really make it interesting. For the last several minutes people were screaming and almost standing. Very impressive.

title: Real world math milestones: Conveyer belt sushi
excerpt: Zach loves sushi and math, I love natural opportunities for learning, so Zach, Amelia and I went to conveyer belt sushi. The cool thing about conveyer belt sushi is the plates are color coded with each plate having a specific price (e.g. blue is 1$, red is 2$). This is a fantastic opportunity for multiplication, and for the first time, Zach was able to compute the price. It warms my heart to see the pride on Zach's face when he was able to figure out the total.

title: Achievement Unlocked: First Chaperone
excerpt: Most memories of my child hood have faded, but one that burns bright is a field trip where my father and sister were chaperones. What a great way to reinforce how important Zach and Amelia are by making time to be with them on their special days.

title: Week 411AZ: Back on the horse!
excerpt: I'm not sure why I've been making excuses for eating poorly, not exercising, and not doing my family newsletter - but this week, maybe it's the sun, maybe it's the constellations, or maybe it's the virtuous circle of goodness begetting goodness - but this week has been fantastic.

title: Week 409AZ: Biking and pot pori
excerpt:
_Zach and I went biking, and got caught in a hail storm - he was not a fan.

I *finally* set up the computer for Zach, and he's really getting into it. Amelia loves it too.

Today I wiped out on my bike. It doesn't happy often, but when it does, I look bad ass, and being male, even a 40 year male, that makes my day. Speaking of bad ass I have a sign in my office to do epic shit - and that's important too.

title: Week 400AZ: Happy Holiday 2017
excerpt:
2017 was great year, and we spent the last two weeks of the year enjoying the family.

We finished the year with our first New Years party since we had kids. It was great!!!

The day before I stopped at the Russian store and got 7 salads, 4 smoked cheeses and meats, and dried and pickled fish. Add to that Tori's fantastic mouse cake and rainbow jello squares and we had a perfect party.

title: Happy jump in the lake day 2018
excerpt:
Every year I jump in the lake to remind myself that "the resistance" is a lie I tell myself to prevent me from making my greatest contribution.

For the first year ever, Zach agreed to come in the lake woohoo

title: Batkid Begins: Everyone coming together to make  a wish.
excerpt:
I cried for the entire 90 minute movie. A few things really impressed me:

* At the core a few folks had a dream.

* Because it mattered, everyone stepped up to do the thing they could do their best at

* Even the crowd can be incredibly decent.

title: Week 398AZ: Lightning Trip to Canada
excerpt:
I decided to make a solo trip to Canada to see my family. It was great to see my niece, mom, sister and brother and law and best friends from college.

The highlight of my trip was getting to hang out with my niece and interact with her as an adult (well young adult). She’s in grade 8 and already dreaming of becoming a physicist. She’s doing advanced math placement tests and blaring out the jazz in her all-star jazz band. I was very lucky to be able to catch her band concert.

title: Week 393AZ: Halloween 2017
excerpt: Halloween is our favorite holiday and this time we out did our selves. While biking Amelia to work (to show her off) in my frog costume many cars honked, waved and gave thumbs up.

title: Week 388AZ: Back on the newsletter horse
excerpt:
There's lots going on in our lives, but most of it isn't getting written down, so I'll go back to the newsletter format.

### In other news:

##### In Family event news

We went to a show called Go.Dog.Go it was true to form representation of the book by the same name. Go. dog. go is a book that only uses 75 different words, and the word dog is repeated 60 times. When I got to the play I was groaning in my head, but no matter how hard I tried to dislike the play, I really enjoyed it, and highly recommend going to see it. Given it's a play with only 75 different words I'm very impressed.

Our porch is coming along swimmingly. You can see the whole structure, and the door is incredibly cool. Along side it, we're cleaning up our yard, and Tori has fixed the damage to our retaining wall caused by some of the construction work.

title: Week 369AZ: Summer has arrived!
excerpt: It's been a long winter but summer has finally arrived in Seattle. It's warm enough that my 5:30 am ride to work is light, warm and enjoyable. And this weekend, has been our first all sun weekend in the high 70s (20 C)!

title: Week 367AZ: Big brothers at Trader Joe's
excerpt:

On this trip, Zach really stepped up his game as a big brother. First he did up Amelia's seat belt. The he watched Amelia when I went to the bathroom, and of course he pushed Amelia around in the cart and finally when we got the stickers at the checkout he shared them with Amelia.

title: Week 366AZ: Glamping with our Friends
excerpt: Now that I work downtown, when we go on an after work adventure involving a ferry, I can meet the family strait on the Ferry. The way this works is I bike to ferry dock and walk onto the ferry. This lets me get a table and find a spot while Tori's parking. Then Zach, Amelia and Tori come up from the parking level and find me. When Zach and Amelia find me, the excitement and pleasure in their eyes is so genuine, raw and sincere - it reminds me how awesome it is to be a parent.

title: Week 365AZ: Porch and Birthday Time
excerpt: It's that time of year again, Zach turning 7, and Amelia turning 3. This year, Zach refused to give us birthday details, so we decided to have a nice quiet birthday part at home. Timing was great because Zach was on spring break so we were able to do all the adventures as a family. Baba stayed in a hip part of town so she was able to experience a new Seattle neighborhood, which is always awesome.

The lack of a view is especially apparent as at this time of year, I'm biking in at sunrise, but facing south with big houses to the west, so I don't get to see much of the sunrise. excerpt: Today was perfect summer weather, and a once in a lifetime event where you could walk on the newly built 520 highway bridge. Salvaging the day, Tori, knowing how much I love riding the subway, told Zach to pick a Subway adventure for us. Zach picked Bainbridge Island, which meant we got to ride the subway to the ferry, hang out on the island and then reverse the process.

excerpt: Friday was perfect. It's been incredibly summer like today. First, a perfect sunny day with a high of 70 (21C). Then I left work @ 3:30 sharp to get my fill of sunshine. When I got home Tori had a pounding headache, so I got an opportunity to give her a well deserved nap. I took the kids off for dinner, and, you guessed it, we took the light rail. Our destination was china town where we ate @ one of Zach's favorite restaurants. The best part of the trip was Zach and Amelia playing together.

title: Week 305AZ: Subway - I mean light rail
excerpt: This week the light rail (which I stubbornly call the subway) station opened by our house - and I love it. In the 7 days it's been open, I've ridden it 10 times, and I'm looking forward to riding it more as I learn what's at stops further down the line. A great thing about taking the family to the subway is it gives us a chance to hang out without hurry or distractions. For example, last night we took 30 no pressure minutes to our destination - frozen yogurt, where we hung out and ate a taste desert before turning around and repeating the process. Because there's no hurry or distraction, we can talk and listen to each other.

title: Zach Week:  July 2015 - Parental Leave Edition

title: Trust the universe, or so say traveling families.
excerpt:

The other families next stop was Everett where they'd buy an RV to drive up and down the west coast before selling it 6 months later in Los Angeles.

title: Live from Seattle: Zach Dvorkin
excerpt:
Zach made up this impromptu magic trick while we rode the bus. I made him perform it to a stranger and he nailed. The next morning we recorded it for posterity.

After recording the magic trick video. Zach wanted to create a public service announcement.

title: Week 270AZ: Medieval puppet shows
excerpt: At noon on Saturday, we arrived at a little medieval festival. Tori warned it would be small, but 20 minutes later, at 12:20, we were back at the gate as we'd seen everything there was to see. I looked at the schedule, and saw they had a puppet show at 12:30, and declared to everyone I wanted to check it out. Zach was adamantly against it.

title: Week 268AZ: No Screens after dinner
excerpt:
Glancing into the living room at 6pm, Tori saw two lumps on the couch. Both lumps had glowing screens, the left lump was Zach on his Kindie, and the right lump was Igor on his Surface.

_ _Dinner’s ready - screens as done for the night_ Yelled Tori as she gave the bigger lumps a dirty look.

title: Week 267Az:  How long have you been alive?
excerpt: _37 years I answered Zach when he asked me about my birthday. I'm not big into birthdays, but this year we accidently went to wild waves for my birthday. Wild waves is a big amusement park (think Canada's Wonder Land for my northern blog readers) that's 30 minutes away from our house. As silly as this sounds it didn't occur to me that when going to Wild Waves we should bring swim suits and towels. The name "wild waves", and the pictures of the many water slides, simply didn't click. Even without the water paraphernalia, there was lots to do. Lots of rides for the kids. There were even a few rides that Zach and Amelia were able to do together. Zach wasn't thrilled by the arrangement, but Amelia thought it was a hoot.

title: Week 262AZ: Paying attention at circus school
excerpt: I write these blog posts while Zach does circus school. Usually I don't pay attention to Zach, and often Zach doesn't pay attention in class. Today I was paying attention, and so was Zach. It brings me pride and pleasure to see Zach doing the exercises with the other students, listening to the teacher, and being generally skilled.

title: Week 261AZ: Birthdays all around
excerpt: This year was Amelia's first birthday and Zach's fifth. Like last year we did it at a local park, and we lucked out on no rain. This year, we did a bbq, and served almost 30 hotdogs and 40 hamburgers, WOOHOO!

title: Week 259AZ: Beach House Vacation
excerpt: This week Tori organized a fantastic vacation. We spent Thursday and Friday on an Whidbey island staying at a beach cabin. It was a perfect few days to be on the beach. We saw rainbows, and the tide was really far out so we had a fun time playing in the sand. Also, the whole time you could hear the waves crashing into the shore, which is a sound I really enjoy.

title: Week 258AZ: Spring Parade
excerpt:
_This post won't do the event justice, but hopefully it'll remind me of principlies and continuing to prioritize those.

Before the week started, we knew it was going to be a busy one. We already knew next week we're going on a mini-vacation so we had a lot of things that needed to get done. We also knew that Zach's school has some family event on Friday meaning even less hours available for work.

title: Week 256AZ: One hundred and sixty eight pounds
excerpt:
Well, not quite, but in a few days I'll be under 170 lbs for the first time in as long as I can remember.

Fifteen months ago I was 210 lbs, and through hard word and vigilance I was able to drop the weight.

title: Week 254AZ: Live (the verb, not the noun)
excerpt: Every day I ride the bus practicing my card tricks. As I sit there shuffling cards I fantasize I am asking those people around me, all of whom are avoiding eye contact by staring into their phones, to pick a card.

title: Week 252AZ: Sunny Spring in Seattle
excerpt: Seattle is having uncarecteristcaly dry, sunny and warm weather, and as a result, all our trees are blooming. It's pretty cool to have spring so early, and to be able to enjoy it with my two charming children, and my one wonderful wife.

title: Week 251AZ: Building roads in Oregon.
excerpt: The family took the week off, and flew down to Oregon, where we had a blast as usual. Zach and I spent a bunch of time on the ranch building a road, while Tori and Amelia got to spend a bunch of time with the sisters, mamas, grandmas and aunts.

title: Week 249AZ: The emotional ordeals of Trader Joe's and Circus School
excerpt:
This week, I was re-reading the 7 habits of highly effective people chapter 5 - See first to understand. As usual the lessons were very helpful

I really enjoy grocery shopping and Trader Joe's is one of my favorite grocery stores. Often, I can get Zach to come with me, by claiming I need his help to avoid rockets, and that without him I won't remember the bubble juice (pop).

title: Week 248AZ: A great way to end the week
excerpt:
I love helping my wife, I love being with my kids, I love riding the bus, I love having flexibility at work, I love living in a place so easy to get to from the bus, and I love making people smile.

I love it when I can combine all these activities into something I really enjoy.

title: Week 247AZ: Long Days, Short years, four years later.
excerpt:
Saturday was a wonderful warm day in Seattle, and we went for a walk in the arboretum. Our walk ended at a playground where we were happily pushing Zach and Amelia in the swings.

That park, and that swing set is burned into my memory as that was the place where a woman saw Tori and I burned out and exhausted pushing Zach in a swing.

title: Week 246AZ: Drained but worth it.
excerpt:
# In other news

In house news, we're still trying to hunt down contractors for the front porch, and Tori has finally gotten sick of my "cardboard" windows, and replaced them with glass. It's pretty sweet being married to a jack of all trades.

title: Week 245AZ: Back to the normal routine
excerpt:
This week it's back to work for me, back to school for Zach, and back to a normal routine for Tori.

# In other news

In house news, we've discovered that the columns holding up our porch roof are hollow, and that's awfully sketchy. We're waiting to see how expensive this will make our porch remodel.

title: Week 244AZ: Friends and Family
excerpt:
This week we were on staycation, and we had a great time filled with friends and family.

Monday, Greg and Ammon, two of my best friends, came to the court house to witness our marriage.

Tuesday, Zach fulfilled one of his bucket list items for 2014, getting to ride a double decker train.

title: Week 243AZ: Kick in the pants
excerpt:
I write this blog series because I made a deliberate decision to make "family first" one of my guiding principles.

From this principle I derive the habit of a weekly family blog post for three reasons.

1) To live the lesson of deliberate discipline, because children become their parents.

title: Happy jump in the lake day 2015
excerpt:
Today was an awesome jump in the lake day. The thermometer read 29 degrees Fahrenheit, but I had my freshly minted wife, my first time at the event daughter, my super awesome son and my lucky bow tie.

Zach and Amelia, when you read this, remember the reason to jump in the lake is to overcome the resistance. The resistance is the enemy of your art, it is the overpowering emotion that paralyzes you in the face of doing the things that matter most.

title: Married -- Check
excerpt:
We're married! Tori claims she got married because I promised her a new porch and I'm happy with that.

**The back story:**

In 2006 Igor met Tori, and have been side by side ever since.

In 2009 Igor got a fortune cookie suggesting marriage agreed with him, so he proposed and Tori agreed.

title: Week 238AZ: The missing conversations
excerpt:
Last week I skipped a bunch of conversations, this week I'll skip some paragraphs and have lots of conversations ....

Zach exploring the grown up world of jobs:

Z: Guess What?

I: What?

Z: I want to be a director

title: Week 237AZ: Getting into the groove
excerpt:
After many weeks of visitors, new jobs, colds, teething, and halloween, we're finally getting into our groove. Here's the whirl wind tour:

Baba came to visit for two weeks and the visit was awesome. Zach and Amelia got to spend a lot of time with their Baba, and Tori and I got some much needed down town. It was really impressive how well Amelia took to Baba because with everyone else Amelia's having Stranger Danger.

title: Week 232AZ:A day on the town with Amelia.
excerpt:
I don't usually get both kids, but Saturday I took Zach and Amelia to a trampoline place by myself. Zach was completely accommodating which I attribute to Tori's fantastic parenting.

On our way to the trampoline place Amelia fell asleep, so as we waited for Amelia to wake up, Zach and I watched some TV In the car. When Amelia woke up the three of us went into the trampoline place. Zach bounced while Amelia and I watched the kids bouncing.

title: Week 231AZ: Not paying attention is expensive
excerpt:
Some weeks everything goes your way, and some weeks it doesn't. This week it doesn't.

I wasn't paying attention to my weight and other commitments, and it became impossible for me to hit my weight loss goals. As a result, I've paid my first 1000$ for a weight loss challenge. On the bright side, this is a great lesson on integrity, carefully committing and monitoring outstanding commitments, and prioritizing your health.

title: Week 230AZ: It's not going to fit.
excerpt: Thursday morning, Maureen and Brian loaded their dogs into their SUV, hooked up their air stream, and started their journey to Seattle. Thirty Seven hours later, their SUV and trailer squeezed through the rows of cars parked on both sides of our narrow street.

title: Week 229AZ: Circus Success
excerpt:
Today was the last day of Zach's summer circus session - which means it is demo day. Tori and I watched with pride as Zach tried all the moves, and landed several of them.

I was amazed to see Zach trying some of the harder moves and being independent as the coach helped other students.

title: Achievement Unlocked: Juggling flaming torches
excerpt:
**Some things to notice:**

1) Zach being the talker for my show.

2) The safety conscious Andrew Field spotting me.

3) The swooshing sounds

4) Tori thinking ahead that I should have burn gel.

(Also called juggling fire)

title: Week 226AZ: Back on the blogging bandwagon
excerpt:
Last last week was family week, and we met Tori and my family.

First, we flew down to Maureen and Brian's, where we got to meet Tori's east coast family, use heavy machinery and have massive water fights.

title: Week 220AZ: The Power of Love
excerpt: I wiped the sweat off my brow as I checked the temperature on my computer - 95 degrees - Christ, no wonder I was snapping at Zach. Seattle was in the middle of a heat wave, and our whole house was snapping at each other.

title: Week 219AZ: Summer Session
excerpt:
"That's why it's so important to hold someones hand while crossing the road", I reinforced as I pulled Zach up after he tripped on the road.

"Do you know what happens and you fall on the road and you don't have grown up?" I continued.

title: Week 218AZ:Completion
excerpt:
"Basement Remodel is done, and Zach's in school". Said the text from Tori. It's been a great week with many things coming together.

# In other news

In house news, we're done with the contractors. Now it's up to us to paint, unpack, arrange, and furnish the basement.

title: Week 216AZ: Camping, Colds, Close to Completion
excerpt:
"Uh, did you bring any food?" I asked Chris, the father who invited Zach and I father and son camping on Father's Day.

"Yup, but I didn't bring or a stove", laughed Chris in reply.

Combined, Chris and I were able to scrounge up enough marshmallows, chips, beans and hot dogs to keep us from starving in the woods on our first boys only camping trip.

title: Week 215AZ: There is never enough room in the bed.
excerpt: Daddy, there's no room in my bed for you, there's only room for my friends - Zach pronounced angrily. "Hey, but aren't I your friend" I replied, slightly hurt. "Of course Daddy, I meant my stuffed animal friends".

title: Week 212AZ: I want another turn
excerpt:
The first time Zach held Amelia:

Z: I want another turn.

I: What? Why?

Z: Because she's a floppy pancake.

`

`

# In other news

In house news, the bathroom is coming along nicely, I peed in the new toilet, washed my hands in the new sink, and played hide and seek with the the new motion detection light switch. With luck we will get our occupancy permit this coming Friday, and we can start on our next projects (the office and water heater).

title: Sprocket - The Birth Story.
excerpt:
“Are you have contractions?”

“No – stop asking, I’ll tell you when I do” Tori snapped back at me.

"Zach, what are you doing!? Do not bring your sand toys in the house!"

"But, mom said I could," whined Zach.

title: Week 210AZ: And now we're four.
excerpt:
Zach is four, and we have four in our family. I'll post a separate article describing our birth story. I also need to decide if I rename this series.

# In other news

In Tori news, she's both fantastic, and doing fantastic. As the normal conversation goes:

title: Sprocket - the final count down
excerpt:
Tori's water has broken, but we aren't yet in labor. Within 72 hours we'll be giving birth.

Keeping Zach and I busy and out of Tori's hair is the tricky part, but at least it's fun.

title: Week 208AZ: Holding Pattern
excerpt: "Go to your room you're in time out" I snapped at Zach as a 2x4 from Zach's latest trap fell two inches from my head. Angry, Zach ran off to his room, while continued to sit on my front porch rocking chair reading.

title: Week 206AZ: Fourth Birthday Party, Two Left Boots and Home made pants.
excerpt: This weekend we had Zach's fourth birthday party and it was a smashing success. We had an outdoor venue on the Puget Sound, with a salmon slide, trains and enough sticks for the boys to have world war three. We got super lucky as it didn't start raining till the last few minutes of the party.

title: Week 203AZ: The foot that kicks, the mouth that hiccups
excerpt: Want to feel hiccups Tori asked? Sure I said looking at her curiously. Stick your hand on belly - said Tori. I did, and I could feel sprocket hiccuping. That was extra special for me, as with Zach, the placenta was attached at the front and I could never feel spud (Zach's code name) kicking.

title: Mr Rogers is my hero.
excerpt: I don't recall seeing Mr. Rogers saying anything that wasn't awesome. Watching this put tears in my eyes. This is Fred Rogers speaking on May 1st 1969 to the senate sub committee.

title: Week 201AZ: Blow
excerpt: Zach loves going to the pool. I don't think it's because he loves swimming, although he is starting to enjoy it. I think it's because the pool is a time when Zach has my full attention, and I have his. In the pool Zach and I give each other our full attention, I'm not thinking about work, or talking to Tori, or even staring off into space. Zach isn't trying to play Kindie, hit things, or watch TV. We're both present, and so our swim dates are an activity we both always want to do.

title: Week 199AZ: Chicken
excerpt:
_Zach won't leave without me, he knows I won't follow - I smirked under my breath as I watched Zach consider going down the staircase alone from my hiding spot behind the rack of clearance jackets.

Arrogantly, I recalled all the times Tori scolded Zach for running away from her. When Zach is with me, I thought with a chuckle, Zach knows if he doesn't watch me, he'll end up alone and afraid, so he stays close. As I pondered my parental superiority, I looked back at the stair case, and realized Zach was gone. My mind filled with irrational thoughts, and I forced a deep breath. Thinking rationally, I worked out that Zach would realize he couldn't find me, freeze and start crying. Understanding the situation, my fists unclenched, and I sauntered to the staircase, smugly looking for Zach. On the ground floor, I saw no sign of him.

title: Week 198AZ: The crying game.
excerpt: Perfect,we'll be there at 11. I hung up the phone with the reservation office. "Zach, you're going to play at the gym when Daddy runs tomorrow - are you excited?" "bababeepogagoo" giggles Zach as he bounces off to watch tv.

title: Tori's Take: January 2014
excerpt:
Hello family

Sorry we have been pretty quiet. We survived the holidays - Zach still has presents that haven't been opened and played with and the neighbors got their annual cookie treats. Mostly though we have been trying to prep and get ready for Sprocket and finish up with everything that I need to apply to nursing school. The former involves having a contractor build some walls in the basement for Igor's office to actually be somewhat Zach proof and a new basement bathroom. The latter just involves me spending way too many hours volunteering at the nearby hospital and taking placement exams. Igor also started with a new team at Microsoft in a slightly different job which thankfully has meant less stress.

title: Week 193AZ:Some weeks life isn't dramatic, and that's a good thing
excerpt: Snow and ice go to the same college - lectured Zach after we told him that even though the car is covered in ice, doesn't mean there is snow on the ground. While Zach continued his lecture on modern meteorology I escorted Zach to the car so we could drop Tori off at the hospital where she'd be volunteering for the next 8 hours. At the entrance to the hospital, as Tori gave Zach his good bye hug, I double checked my todo list for the day. As Tori went to the hospital, we drove to our first chore - bulk grocery shopping at cash and carry.

title: A message for Tori
excerpt: We've been together for the best years of my life. Today, you're planning a basement remodel, volunteering at a hospital, raising a 4 year old and growing our next child. I love you.

title: Happy  jump in the lake day 2014
excerpt: Every year I jump in the freezing lake on January first. This January first, I didn't want to jump in the lake. It was cold outside, I was tired, Tori was feeling icky, Zach was being grumpy. As I tried to talk myself out of polar plunging, I realized I was late for the plunge so I herded my family, and quickly drove off to the beach. As I sat at a stop light, already late, I realized I forgot my sandals. I hate walking on rocks, especially when I'm in freezing water, shivering, with numb feet. But I didn't have time to get home, so I kept driving to the lake.

title: Achievement Unlocked: Song Produced: Two wheels full of grace
excerpt: Bicycling is great, but there are few songs about it. Here's one I wrote and produced - see the details by clicking on the image or going here.

title: My name is Dr. Bug
excerpt: Zach wants everyone to call him Dr. Bug, as he loves to control robots. We shouldn't encourage this behavior, but I have trouble helping my self:

title: Week 191AZ: Today is the best day of my life
excerpt: Gripping the walker for dear life, desperately trying to stay vertical, Zach pawed furiously at the ice with his skates. Two inches from the skating rink entrance, for the thirty seconds since we got on the ice, I hold the walker and tell Zach to relax and lean forward. It's pointless though, Zach's first time on the ice is a failure, and we both know it. I help Zach take the two steps off the ice, and escort him to Tori, who on account of Sprocket not wanting to be squished, has decided to stay off the ice. Tori, Zach and I are at the skating rink as Julia, one of Zach's best friends, wanted to go skating.

title: Week 190AZ: Choosing Santa Trains
excerpt:
"I love you too" I whispered to Zach as I turned off his bedroom light, and took a moment to reflect on my day as a father.....

The day started with me half asleep, searching for my instant coffee. "We've got circus school, and then the Santa train" Tori briefed me, as she sipped her own coffee and continued, "I'll be coming to circus school so we can get to the Santa train on time, it's a two hour drive". "Yup" I nodded, trying to keep a positive look on my face.

title: Week 188AZ:  Digging Ditches
excerpt: "Daddy, is it morning yet?", whispered Zach as we laid in bed watching the sun rise. "Not yet", I answered hoping to squeeze a few extra minutes of sleep out of the morning. "But Dada, the bobcat has lots of chores it needs to finish".

title: Week 184AZ:  Three and a half year old independence
excerpt: "Zach what do you need to do before crossing the road?" I asked as I scanned the road for cars. Since Zach didn't answer I turned my head and saw Zach with pants around his ankles and urine arching onto the grass.

title: Halloween 2013: Zach's Turn
excerpt:
This year, Zach didn't want to go out for Halloween, but wanted to give out candy instead.

Some funny moments during Halloween

Z: I don't want to hand out lollipops, but I'll give one to the next kids.

When a teenager came to the door_

title: Week 183AZ: When a leaf falls in the forest
excerpt: Breathe in, breathe out, breathe in breathe out, I'm brought back to awareness as I hear the crinkling of footsteps over leaves. I keep my eyes closed, letting he footsteps get closer before I acknowledge them.

title: Voicemail from a three year old
Week 182AZ:Sprocket
excerpt:
I: I wish I could go to circus school with you, but they don't let grown ups in.

Z: It's ok, I know what we can do.

I: What's that?

Z: I invented a turnbackinator.

I: Huh, what's a turnbackinator?

Z: It makes grownups into little kids

title: Week 178AZ: Don't Look
excerpt: "Don't Look" screeched Zach as his urine formed a golden waterfall off the side of our front porch. Thirty seconds earlier I was trying to find what Zach was doing outside. Thirty seconds earlier I told Zach his kindle would need to take a break if he refused to pee.

title: Week 177AZ: Stop I've got to poo!
excerpt: Swerving into the parking lot of a downtown gas station, I bolted from my seat to get Zach out of the car. I intended to succeed this first time Zach asked to poo while driving. I hurried Zach to the door of the 7/11 but Zach dug in his heels preventing me from pulling him into the gas station. "I want to poo on a tree" Zach declared. I froze in my tracks, temporarily confused. My eyes darted around looking for a secluded tree, but being down town, there are none to be found. I returned to my senses and negotiated with Zach. A few minutes laters, Zach flushed the toilet, washed his hands, and I nodded approval to my reflection in the gas station's bathroom mirror.

title: Week 174AZ: Sammie, Yelena And Justin
excerpt: "It's ok, we'll call them on Skype", said Zach as Yelena, my sister, and I were wiping away our parting tears. Aunt Yelena, Uncle Justin and Cousin Sammy, better known as the Potts', were visiting us from their home in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada.

title: Re-speaking: Speak to us of children
excerpt:
Today we have a re-run of this post, sadly my original recording was lost.

\--

I originally recorded this five months before I had Zach, and I still need to remember this poem.

excerpt:
Zach is growing up. He's getting a little too big to fit into ride on cars, he's starting to negotiate, and his intelligence is starting to blossom.

excerpt:
I expect when Zach grows up, he'll say much worse. Zach has some interesting idea's about what it means to be grown up, for example:

Z: No I'm Small

Z: When I'm big I can do lots of stuff

title: Week 170AZ: Live and learn
excerpt:
We were on vacation this week and it was awesome.

As usual, Tori did all the leg work, for which our small family is eternally grateful. Our week included a cabin on guemes island from which we went crabbing, and kayaking to an island. Back in Seattle, Daddy got a giant tricycle.

title: Stop throwing your toothpicks in the urinals, the crabs are learning to pole vault..
excerpt:
... read the graffiti on the urinal wall on our way to Geumes Island. Geumes is a secret island in the San Juanes known only to crab fishers, beach combers and retired KGB agents.

This year, our annual Guemes trip landed during crabbing season, and Tori was resolute we'd be catching crab. While I was busy gathering sun screen and lawn chairs, Tori invested in crab pots, floats, and raw chicken drumsticks. As Tori described the crabbing processes, my imagination flip flopped between the worlds deadliest catch and a geriatric bingo game played on rowboats.

title: Week 169AZ: Glamping Tales
excerpt:
**Marching Band**

I'm encased in a cacophony of laughing, giggling, and squeals of joy. I'm walking the loop of the campsite like a conductor in a marching band. Instead of waving a baton, I'm balancing a ball on the back of my hand, and instead of a brass section, I'm followed by a gaggle of preschoolers on an assortment of bikes, trikes and scooters.

title: Week 166AZ: Zach's First Camping Trip
excerpt: The mountains glow orange from the setting sun. I wiggle to get comfortable on the rock beach, while plants himself on my lap. We both throw big handfuls of rocks into the Puget Sound, screaming with delight

title: Week 161AZ: Girlfriends and reflections on parenting
excerpt: I often tell new parents and non-parents that kids are like hard drugs, the lows are brutal but the highs are to die for. When you are with your kid, and they're not listening, telling you "Hey you can't put me in timeout" or "you made up house rules, I'll make up my own house rules", those can be draining. But when you come home, and the first time your kid sees you his face lights up with a huge ear to ear smile, the high you get for that minute is off the chart.

title: Magicians making housecalls
excerpt: When your sink leaks, a plumber makes a house call. When your fridge is empty and your stomach growls like the neurotic pacing lion at the zoo, a pizza boy makes a house call. When you're face is green, and fluids escape from your orifices like a river overflowing, a doctor makes a house call. Why then, isn't there someone to make a house call when you can't smile.

title: Week 160AZ: Wonderful Weekends.
excerpt: Tori has been pushing us out on the weekends, and as a result we've been having a wonderful time. Last weekend was one of my favorites and it started with Zach and I letting Tori get some well-deserved morning shut eye. With Tori snoozing Zach set the tone by asking if he could sit in my lap and read a book (Zach, if you can read my thoughts, sit in my lap more often, it always puts a smile on my face)

title: It's not science, it's an experiment!
excerpt: A picture, 1000 words. a video, a few less. Tori's science experiments - priceless.

title: Week 158/159AZ: Selected Vignettes from a 3 year old.
excerpt:
Composing coherent blog posts is hard. Instead I'll share some of my favorite vignettes and experiences on select topics.

**Flat Sammy and troll food.**

This week we got a flat version of Zach's cousin Samantha in the mail. We're taking her on a tour of Seattle and our first stop was the Fremont troll. This troll lives under a bridge and can be seen eating a car. Now, I tried to tell Zach that this troll happens to eat humans, but Zach corrected me.

title: Week 156/157AZ: Children in the attic
excerpt:
Like walking and talking Zach's imagination skill is starting to develop. It's a blast to experience and enjoy.

For example, Zach is now pretending our chicken coop is an egg time machine. I'm not sure how an egg relates to a time machine, but that's what imagination is all about. Zach also likes to take imaginative pretend "pee's on the potty." Pretend pee's don't sound like much, but assure you me, getting his butt on the potty is an improvement. And to start the day, Tori's favorite, when Zach wakes up when it's still dark he runs down stairs opens the front door and says "Mom, wake up - it's sunny!"

title: Week 155AZ: Kid-O-Palooza at Zach's!
excerpt: The highlight of this week was Zach's third birthday party hosted at our place. As usual, Tori pulled out all the stops and the party was a one of a kind screaming success! Zach had a riot at our six hour party, and was disappointed every time he realized someone else had left.

title: Seattle Poetry Slam Finals 2013
excerpt: You can listen to the recording @ http://m.ustream.tv/channel/theseattlepoetryslam. The competition starts at 1h11 minutes. It's cool hearing many of the poets and poems that crushed me at the poetry slam. I've got a year to practice before the next finals .

title: Adventures in Relationships: The basketball hoop incident
excerpt: Zach's friend Malcolm was over last night, and Tori was talking to Malcolm's parents John and Misty. I was working in the basement, when I heard John yell "ZACH, that is not OK". Some commotion followed, and Zach was whisked off to bed. I was paged to read Zach's bedtime story, and I asked Zach what happened:

title: Week 154AZ: Happy 3rd Birthday
excerpt: This week was Zach's birthday, and we got lots of videos, I'll post some. His party will be next week. My mom (babba) was making fun of me, as I never wanted to have birthday parties for Zach, but she's right you don't get a choice in such affairs.

title: There are no scraps of men
excerpt:
Awesome story about doing the right thing, leadership and dignity. From TED:

Alberto Cairo's clinics in Afghanistan used to close down during active fighting. Now, they stay open. In this powerful talk, Cairo tells the moving story of why -- and how he found humanity and dignity in the midst of war.

title: Week 153AZ: Daddy, can you read me a story and put me to bed.
excerpt: The title is odd, because Zach never wants me to read him a story when Tori is around, and even odder since Zach has never wanted to go to bed of his own free will. Not being one to look a gift horse in the mouth, I said, sure and then crawled into bed and said:

title: Roach Motel
excerpt: Long ago, I posted about the house I wanted to live in, now it's Tori's turn. Tori wants to build an insect hotel. They come in lots of cool designs, and you can see a whole catalog of them,here. Knowing Tori, insect hotel construction is already on the drafting table. I'll send a picture in a few years when ours is open for Beesness :) .

title: Start your day
excerpt:
This story starts at 5 o'clock

With screaming from an alarm clock

Eyes shut, lying warm in bed

Need to get up, need to clear your head.

Now upright, turn on the light

title: Double Passing

title: Week 152AZ: Daddy, are we clowns?
excerpt: _This morning, Zach asked me if we were clowns. I thought about it, and proudly said, why yes Zach we are. We then had a long conversation focused on the important role that smiles have making people laugh, and why it is integral to the fabric of our society.

excerpt:
Only parents can understand how awesome it is when your kid starts using the potty, and we are experiencing that awesomeness this week.

Sure it comes at a cost. We trade TV time for time on the potty. Zach's been watching loads of TV while sitting on the potty, but as they say in war, a small price to pay.

title: Week 148AZ: I Don't Care.
excerpt: I didn't take any notes about this week other than Zach starting to say "I don't care." Zach surprisingly doesn't care about lots of things: diaper changes, bed time, getting out of mud puddles, putting his toys away and so on.

title: When the Color Blue Was Born - Week 4 Indigo/Purple
excerpt:
**Homework: Seeing through blue**

Blue is lack of color, lack of joy, lack of pleasure

Blue is being present in body, but lost in spirit

Blue is insignificant ego swimming in a sea of self doubt

title: Week 147AZ:Tales of the Zach
excerpt:
I: Villains?

Z: Yeah, Villains, bad guys?

I: What do bad buys do?

Z: Bad stuff

Z: Like Germs, Germs make you sick.

I: What happens when you're sick?

Z: Stuff comes out your mouth

For those of you wondering about where some of these concepts comes from or why Zach uses words like "villains," the answer is cartoons and Mom. Zach has started watching Spiderman cartoons and Mom has been trying to explain about bad guys versus good guys. Snidely Whiplash fan that she is, Mom taught Zach about villains, which is a much cooler word than 'bad guys.' Mom is also trying to convince Zach to cover his mouth and nose when sneezing and to wash his hands, hence the germ discussion. Mom is also a little paranoid about the annual family flu that seems to strike around Zach's birthday and might have told Zach a few times too often that we are not doing the flu this year

title: Week 146AZ: Bear, Bear Bear and Learning about Money
excerpt: I'm very fond of naming things; I'd say it's one of my defining skills. The apple doesn't fall far from the tree and Zach has my naming knack. You see Zach's got a teddy bear and he calls it Bear. When Zach got a second bear he called it Bear Bear. I'm proud. I couldn't have done better myself.

title: When the color blue was born - poetry class week 2 - orange and yellow
excerpt:
Useful things I learned:

* Poets look down on my desire to rhyme and use couplets.

* I tend to classify "poems" that don't use rhyme as bad prose.

* Prose writers are called Prosers.

* Orange and Red are often misnamed:. Fire Trucks are red, fires are not. Red heads are orange.

title: Week 145AZ: Canollies, Canollies, Canollies.
excerpt: Zach, like his father, likes to be the center of attention - It's kind of a problem. When other people are talking Zach will start to scream. Today, while Chiyako was trying to have a conversation with Tori, Zach screamed Canollies, Canollies, Canollies, By the way that picture of Chiyako was taken by Zach - he's got the artist's eye :)

title: Thank you for adopting us ...
excerpt:
Thank you for adopting us

Sure you'll say you made no fuss.

But when we lounge upon your couch

and when our kid is such a grouch

When something silly I have said

and Tori's eyes roll in her head

That's when your kindness is stretched longest,

title: The Doties
excerpt:
John and Misty you make me feel good,

Add in Malcolm and you're my familyhood

Your kid is cute, your kid is smart

He is so awesome he stands apart.

At circus school or playing chase

He's full of energy and sets the pace.

title: A Party For Sam
excerpt:
Boys and Girls, dear Moms and Dad

Birthday, christmas, graduation, barmitzvah

title: When the color blue was born - poetry class week 1 - red
excerpt: This year I’m on a lucky streak. For example, the poetry class I wanted to take on Wed Night was cancelled, and I didn't find out till Tuesday at 3pm. Instead of being sad, I asked the messenger if she had other class recommendations, and she mentioned I takeWhen the color blue was born which started that night. Tori was kind enough to grant me permission and off I went to my first writing class – 35 years into life.

title: Week 144AZ: Home Alone
excerpt:
Most of this week Tori and Zach were in California spending time with Grammy (Tori's mom) and Zach's four month old cousin Kathy, so this post will be mostly about my adventures.

It is weird that every day for the last 3 years I've wished for peace and quiet. "Just a few more minutes" I have begged for myself day in and day out. This week, with Tori and Zach out of town, my wish was granted. Man was I lonely. The highlight of my day was the picture Tori would send, or a call on Skype with my family. Thank you Tori for sending me pictures daily, and Skyping even when you were exhausted.

title: Week 142/143AZ: I want to be like you when I grow up
excerpt:
As I mentioned last week, Zach's a person now, here's a few things the little man said:

Z: I want to be like you when I grow up.

Z: I want a Zach sized police car.

Z: leave the radio on

__Z: Why not stopping at Benna (the play spot is Ravenna which Zach pronounced Benna).

title: First Flush
excerpt: If you're not a parent, seeing your kids first flush doesn't make a lot of sense. The first time they do though, you want something like this:

title: Week 141AZ: I live with a little human being
excerpt:
This was the week where I finally figured out that I live with a small human being! Joy, Pleasure, Awesomeness! Here is how I came to this realization...

I've been on vacation for three weeks, so I've been waking up at 5 am and working on my computer projects in the basement.

title: My first going out to dinner with Zach
excerpt: Today, for the first time in his life, I took Zach out for dinner with me, where Zach was my date. Sure I've taken him in the past, but in those cases Zach was a possession, not a human companion. Here are some of our conversations:

title: Week 140AZ: Mad and Sad
excerpt: **On Monday** we lucked out and had Christmas day dinner at our friends Paul, Sandra, Ben, and Sam's house. They had invited grandparents, aunts and several neighbors with kids of various ages there so it was quite the party. Zach headed straight to the playroom and ignored the grown ups and other kids for most of the night. He came down occasionally for food in between chasing his four year old friend Ben with a Nerf gun and playing trains. He was finally carried out crying and saying vehemently that he wanted to stay. We bribed him with some of Sandra's smashed potatoes and he finally decided that maybe he would go to bed at home.

title: Happy jump in the lake day 2013
excerpt:
Cold, Freezing, Wet, Brr

Too long, and you'll start to slur

People screaming at the shore

Souls ready for their soar

Four, three, two, one

Run in and have your fun

Feet, Knees, Nuts, Neck

Are you crazy what the heck?

title: Week 138/139AZ: Snow and Snuggles
excerpt: It's Christmas time in the Pacific North West and Zach thinks he's Santa Clause. Zach acquired this notion after giving out the tasty cookies he and Tori made for our neighbors. Next year we'll have to make more cookies and deliver them to more neighbors. I wish I had made videos. There is nothing cuter than a neighbor opening their door and Zach handing them a gift bag saying "here you go" before walking away while humming 'Jingle Bells'. Zach, like his dad, knows two holidays songs - Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer and Jingle Bells - and sings them or hums them constantly most days.

title: Planning the upstairs
excerpt: We've started our big remodel planning. Here's one of the first drafts of the upstairs. If you're interested I can send you the plans they're drawn in SweetHome3D.

Tori, you are my love,

Tori, you are my dove.

You make me laugh, you make me cry.

When I'm with you I feel so sly.

You are the best Mom I know,

I wish to say that in stereo

My love for you is hard to measure,

title: Week 137AZ: Best Weekend Ever
excerpt: _We did a bunch this week but I had so much fun this weekend that it is all I want to talk about. Usually I lack the stamina and Tori lacks the trust to let me have Zach for most of the weekend, but this weekend the magic happened, so I'll give you the blow by blow:

title: Week 136AZ: O Christmas Tree
excerpt:
This was a great week. Zach has made some real progress, Tori's finished painting the living room, and Dad's feeling great from the above and stuff going well at work.

Zach started by saying some very cute stuff this week:

excerpt:

title: Week 135AZ: Flooding, Trenching and the Family Ranch
excerpt: When they say owning is better than renting they fail to take into consideration things like leaking roofs and flooding basements. Thanks to our Mason's quick action the roof is now patched, and we now own our own shop vac which Zach and Tori used to dry out the basement. We've got some ideas as to what caused our basement troubles and are working on necessary repairs. We just need to buckle down and wait for the next storm to see if the repairs have worked.

title: Week 134AZ: Zach Painting
excerpt:
Short post this week, I'll post more at thanksgiving.

I've been waiting for the living room to appear painted for about a year now, and it finally happened. It turns out the magic is letting Zach paint. Any hoo, 3 more walls painted this week, and at this point we've just got to complete the accent walls.

Zach convinced me it's less effort to sit in his bed till he falls asleep than to listen to him scream - so here I am. Zach never wore this dragon suite which is a shame as it was awesome, but we somehow conned him into wearing the dragon head.

excerpt:

* Tori painted a strip of the living room (I don't think we'll keep it, but it's progress after a long hiatus)

* Zach did everything at circus school and even volunteered to go first

title: Week 132AZ: Canadian Turkey Day
excerpt: Every year we celebrate Canadian thanksgiving by picking a random day in November and declaring it Canadian thanksgiving. Then we invite all our friends (all of whom are Canadian, married to a Canadian, or otherwise good people) to a cabin in the woods, put one of them in charge of cooking a turkey, and feast for the weekend!
